segments.text: Hello Mr . Jones , please have a seat . Thank you for coming in today . I have read your resume . You completed University in England ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I went to Cambridge . After graduation , I started right away into the advertising industry . Later , I made a bit of a switch to focus on marketing research .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So , what experience do you have ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I have ten years marketing experience . This includes both entry level and management positions . In my last position , I worked my way up to being director of the marking department .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I can see that from your resume.Your last position was marketing director for a pharmaceutical company , is that right ? Later , why did you decide to leave your former post ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I felt after five years in one place , I was ready for something new . I would like to have a job that is challenging , something that I can see and do new things every day . I loved many things about my former job , and I left with amiable feelings on both sides . I was just ready for something new .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Do you want to work full-time or part-time ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll make note of that . Now , what are your salary expectations ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I am willing to negotiate , but I expect at least $ 40,000 a year .
segments.speaker: S2
